verses.verse: (Judgment on Wicked Counselors) (Ezek 3.12, 14; 8.3, 16; 10.19) The spirit lifted me up and brought me to the east gate of the house of the LORD, which faces east. There, at the entrance of the gateway, were twenty-five men; among them I saw Jaazaniah son of Azzur and Pelatiah son of Benaiah, officials of the people.
(Isa 30.1; Mic 2.1) He said to me, “Mortal, these are the men who devise iniquity and who give wicked counsel in this city;
(Jer 1.13; Ezek 12.22, 27; 24.3, 6; 2 Pet 3.4) they say, ‘The time is not near to build houses; this city is the pot, and we are the meat.’
(Ezek 3.4, 17) Therefore prophesy against them; prophesy, O mortal.”

(Jer 11.20; Ezek 2.2; 3.24; 38.10) Then the spirit of the LORD fell upon me, and he said to me, “Say, Thus says the LORD: This is what you think, O house of Israel; I know the things that come into your mind.
(Ezek 7.23; 22.3, 4) You have killed many in this city and have filled its streets with the slain.
(v 9|EZK 11:9; Ezek 24.3, 6, 10, 11; Mic 3.3) Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: The slain whom you have placed within it are the meat, and this city is the pot, but you shall be taken out of it.
You have feared the sword, and I will bring the sword upon you, says the Lord GOD.
(Ps 106.41; Ezek 5.8) I will take you out of it and give you over to the hands of foreigners and execute judgments upon you.
(2 Kings 14.25; 25.19-21; Jer 52.10; Ezek 6.7) You shall fall by the sword; I will judge you at the border of Israel. And you shall know that I am the LORD.
This city shall not be your pot, and you shall not be the meat inside it; I will judge you at the border of Israel.

(v 10|EZK 11:10; Ezek 8.10, 14, 16; 18.8, 9) Then you shall know that I am the LORD, whose statutes you have not followed and whose ordinances you have not kept, but you have acted according to the ordinances of the nations that are around you.”

(v 1|EZK 11:1; Ezek 9.8) Now, while I was prophesying, Pelatiah son of Benaiah died. Then I fell down on my face, cried with a loud voice, and said, “Ah Lord GOD! You are finishing off the remnant of Israel!”
(God Will Restore Israel) Then the word of the LORD came to me:

(Ezek 33.24) Mortal, your kinsfolk, your own kin, your fellow exiles, (Gk Syr: Heb people of your kindred) the whole house of Israel, all of them, are those of whom the inhabitants of Jerusalem have said, “Stay far from the LORD; to us this land is given for a possession.”

(Isa 8.14) Therefore say: Thus says the Lord GOD: Though I removed them far away among the nations and though I scattered them among the countries, yet I have been a sanctuary to them for a little while (Or a little sanctuary) in the countries where they have gone.

(Jer 24.5; Ezek 28.25; 34.13) Therefore say: Thus says the Lord GOD: I will gather you from the peoples and assemble you out of the countries where you have been scattered, and I will give you the land of Israel.
(Ezek 37.23) When they come there, they will remove from it all its detestable things and all its abominations.

(Jer 32.39; Ezek 18.31; 36.26, 27; Zech 7.12; 2 Cor 3.3) I will give them one heart and put a new spirit within them; (Heb mss Gk Syr Vg: MT you) I will remove the heart of stone from their flesh and give them a heart of flesh,
(Ps 105.45; Ezek 14.11) so that they may follow my statutes and keep my ordinances and obey them. Then they shall be my people, and I will be their God.

(Ezek 9.10) But as for those whose heart goes after their detestable things and their abominations, (Cn: Heb And to the heart of their detestable things and their abominations their heart goes) I will bring their deeds upon their own heads, says the Lord GOD.
(Ezek 1.19; 10.19) Then the cherubim lifted up their wings, with the wheels beside them, and the glory of the God of Israel was above them.
(Ezek 8.4; 9.3; Zech 14.4) And the glory of the LORD ascended from the middle of the city and stopped on the mountain east of the city.
The spirit lifted me up and brought me in a vision by the spirit of God into Chaldea, to the exiles. Then the vision that I had seen left me.
And I told the exiles all the things that the LORD had shown me.
